page.title: 06A DAY AT FORD PRISON
page.content: The prison at Ford is in buildings which used to be part of a Royal Navy Air Station.Other parts of the Air Station are now an industrial estate. The day begins with roll-call at 7.00am with breakfast at 7.30.Between 9.00 and 12.00 the prisoners do "chores" which could be gardening,cleaning up or moving things.Lunch is at 12.00 and is followed by "Freetime" when the men do more sports or gym or more chores.Five o'clock is tea-time and then the prisoners do more chores until the 7.00pm roll-call.Supper at 8.00pm is usually something like bangers and mash.The prisoners have to go to bed at 9 o'clock and "lights out" is at 10.00.
